Class FileUtil

java.lang.Object
FileUtil
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class FileUtil
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
this class handles reading and writing on files. just server can use this class to handle the files.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • FileUtil

      public FileUtil()

  • Method Details

    • openUserFile

      public User openUserFile​(java.lang.String userName)
      this method gets the username of the user who wants to log in. if the user logged in before , this method reads it from the file and returns it (user) , if it is the first time the user logs in , this method creates new user with this username and adds it to the files and returns this user.
      Parameters:
      userName - username of the user who wants to log in
      Returns:
      the user

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame​(User user)
      this method gets a user and writes it on it's file. in other words, it updates the given user and saves it.
      Parameters:
      user - current user whose information should be updated

    • saveRankings

      public void saveRankings​(User user)
      this method receives a user and adds it to the rankings of the game. if ranking file exists , this method updates it's data but if it doesn't exist , this method creates it and adds this user to it.
      Parameters:
      user - user should be added to the rankings

    • returnRanking

      public static Ranking returnRanking()
      this methods reads the rankings file and returns it.
      Returns:
      rankings which is read from file.

    • ChangeUsername

      public static boolean ChangeUsername​(User user, java.lang.String newUsername)
      this method is used to change the username of the given user to the new username which is received in the constructor. this method checks if there exists a user in the file whose username equals the new username , it doesn't change it and returns false, but if it is new to the file, it changes the username and replace old file with new one and saves it and returns true.
      Parameters:
      user - user whose username is asked to be changed
      newUsername - new username of the user
      Returns:
      if the username is changed, it returns true else returns false

    • replaceInRanking

      public static void replaceInRanking​(User user, java.lang.String newUsername)
      when the username of a user is changed , this method is called to replace the old username with the new one in the rankings file.
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose username is changed
      newUsername - new username of the user
